title: `datalad push`-friendly remote config from `clone/create-sibling`
body:
My desire was to push all relevant branches of a dataset to github (master, git-annex), but `push` wouldn't do it.

```
% datalad push --to origin --force no-datatransfer                                                                      
```

That is, because `push` does what Git would do:

```
% git push origin          
fatal: The current branch master has no upstream branch.    
To push the current branch and set the remote as upstream, use
                                                                                             
    git push --set-upstream origin master                                                   
```

so I was left with

```
% git push origin git-annex
Enumerating objects: 5070, done.
Counting objects: 100% (5070/5070), done.
Delta compression using up to 16 threads
Compressing objects: 100% (2985/2985), done.
Writing objects: 100% (3265/3265), 275.68 KiB | 5.74 MiB/s, done.
Total 3265 (delta 1190), reused 0 (delta 0)
remote: Resolving deltas: 100% (1190/1190), completed with 1165 local objects.
To github.com:datalad-datasets/hcp-structural-preprocessed.git
   4853f6be..7a81424f  git-annex -> git-annex
```

In contrast to `push` trusty old `publish` does not follow Git config (and therefore would have done "the right thing"), but in other scenarios users might suffer from the ignorance/deviant ideas of `publish`.

So, I wonder if `clone` and `create-sibling-*` (or rather `siblings add`) should pay more attention and configure proper `remote.*.push` settings, such that `publish` can keep being close to Git? And a plain `git push` would also "do the right thing".

FTR:
```
# config as a result of `datalad clone`
[remote "origin"]
        url = git@github.com:datalad-datasets/hcp-structural-preprocessed.git
        fetch = +refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/origin/*
        annex-ignore = true
# config as a result of `create-sibling-ria`
[remote "inm7"]
        annex-ignore = true
        url = /ds/hcp/srv/aef/339ec-889f-11ea-9d9c-a0369f287950
        fetch = +refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/inm7/*
```

Is there any scenario, where we want to clone an annex dataset, and do not want to be able to push the `git-annex` branch back **by default**? Likewise, is there any scenario, where we want to create a sibling, and not push an annex-branch **by default**?

If that is not desirable, we have to change the way `push` makes decisions.
